description: The very public end-of-life experiences of high profile figures during the past year has brought death and dying to the forefront of public discourse. Many questions continue to be debated publicly, including: How do people want to live as they are dying? What are the needs of people who are seriously ill at the end of life? How, as a society and as individuals, do we address these needs? Starting with reading Nuland's "How we die" and Kubler-Ross's "On death and dying", this course will explore the answers to these questions from the perspectives of medicine, sociology, religion, and anthropology.
name: DYING IN AMERICA: Dying In America: Caring For The Dying
